dependencies.description:
The Environment for Tree Exploration (ETE) is a Python programming
toolkit that assists in the recontruction, manipulation, analysis and
visualization of phylogenetic trees (although clustering trees or any
other tree-like data structure are also supported).
dependencies.name: py-ete3

dependencies.description: Implementation of the Markov clustering (MCL) algorithm in python
dependencies.name: py-markov-clustering

dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependencies.name: py-matplotlib

dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.
dependencies.name: py-networkx

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

description:
Possvm (Phylogenetic Ortholog Sorting with Species oVerlap and MCL) is a
python tool to analyse pre-computed gene trees and identify pairs and
clusters of orthologous genes. It takes advantage of the species overlap
algorithm implemented in the ETE toolkit to parse the phylogeny and
identify orthologous gene pairs, and MCL clustering for orthogroup
identification.
name: possvm

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
